title: Ellen Hoog
text:
Ellen Marijn Hoog (, born 26 March 1986) is a former Dutch <a href="field%20hockey">field hockey</a> player, who is regarded as one of the best Dutch hockey players of her generation.
Field hockey career.
Ellen began playing field hockey at the age of seven and in 2002, aged 16 she was selected to play her first senior game for <a href="Stichtse%20Cricket%20en%20Hockey%20Club">Stichtse Cricket en Hockey Club</a> in Bilthoven and made her debut for the <a href="Netherlands%20women%27s%20national%20field%20hockey%20team">Netherlands women's national field hockey team</a> at age 17 in 2004 and has played in 232 matches, scoring 60 goals. She won Olympic gold medals in 2008 and 2012 and a silver medal in 2016.
In August 2005, she became European champion in <a href="2005%20Women%27s%20EuroHockey%20Nations%20Championship">Dublin</a>. In December of the same year she won the <a href="2005%20Women%27s%20Champions%20Trophy%20%28field%20hockey%29">Champions Trophy</a> in <a href="Canberra">Canberra</a> with the Dutch national women's team. She was a part of the Dutch squad's which won the <a href="2006%20Women%27s%20Hockey%20World%20Cup">2006 Women's Hockey World Cup</a> and the <a href="2014%20Women%27s%20Hockey%20World%20Cup">2014 Women's Hockey World Cup</a>. She was also named as the best player of the 2014 Women's Hockey World Cup.
In 2012, Hoog became the first player to decide a major championship match with a penalty shootout, taking the winning shot in the <a href="2012%20Summer%20Olympics">2012 Summer Olympics</a> semi-final against <a href="New%20Zealand%20women%27s%20national%20field%20hockey%20team">New Zealand</a>. She repeated this feat in 2016 when she took the winning shot in the <a href="2016%20Summer%20Olympics">2016 Summer Olympics</a> semi against <a href="Germany%20women%27s%20national%20field%20hockey%20team">Germany</a>.
She retired from international duty in 2016. She then later retired from hockey at her club <a href="Amsterdamsche%20Hockey%20%26amp%3B%20Bandy%20Club">Amsterdamsche Hockey & Bandy Club</a> in may of 2017.
Style of play.
Ellen Hoog is a specialist when it comes to reverse shooting. She is precise and strong when it comes to the forehand shot, she uses this skill to execute the penalty corners. Her offensive speed and ability to change directions so quickly, made her one of the most dangerous midfielders in the world.
Personal life.
In 2013 she was in a bikini shoot in the 'Swimsuit Edition 2013' of the American sports magazine Sports Illustrated. In August 2015, her book "In perfecte conditie" (In perfect condition) was published.
Ellen Hoog married her long-term boyfriend in June 2017, after ending her career as a professional. She gave birth to her daughter in February of 2019.
Honours.
Netherlands women's national field hockey team
AH&BC
